alert.note: Alert for Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 9:42AM CDT until July 13 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR LOUISVILLE... The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Winston County in east central Mississippi... * Until 345 PM CDT Thursday. * At 942 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported high water rescues due to thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Louisville. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Louisville. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Louisville, Noxapater, Millcreek, Mcmillan and Betheden. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
